citation.article-title: Cerasicoccus arenae gen. nov., sp. nov., a carotenoid-producing marine representative of the family Puniceicoccaceae within the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia', isolated from marine sand
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Cerasicoccus (Ce.ra.si.coc′cus. L. neut. n. cerasum a cherry; Gr. masc. n. kokkos berry; N.L. masc. n. Cerasicoccus referring to the pale-pink colour of the bacterium).
Cells are cocci, Gram-negative and obligately aerobic.
Cells lack flagella and are non-motile.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-7.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C14 : 0 and C18 : 1ω9c.
The type species is Cerasicoccus arenae.
